page.title: 14Burford Dragon Procession
page.content: The Dragon Procession took place on the 23rd June,in the early evening moving down the hill.Headed by a police car, the procession was followed by a group of Morris Men who came dancing down the street in their largeÂ£horse'weaving in and out amongst themselves and the spectators,causing much hilarity.Behind the Dancers was the dragon with a large gaudily painted and ferocious looking face and its body about 30'long.The body was made of brightly coloured material fixed over large hoops forming a tunnel,inside of which,numerous children provided mobility.The procession moved down the Hill,down Church Lane and into the Church Green, where everyone congregated.Revd.Moody said a St.John's Day collect,gave a blessing and a hymn was sung.Morris dancing followed.The only break from tradition,was no Giant or Mummers.
